connector.description: Watch specific etcd keys or directories for changes.

camel.source.path.path.name: camel.source.path.path
camel.source.path.path.description: The path the endpoint refers to

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.servicePath.name: camel.source.endpoint.servicePath
camel.source.endpoint.servicePath.description: The path to look for for service discovery

camel.source.endpoint.uris.name: camel.source.endpoint.uris
camel.source.endpoint.uris.description: To set the URIs the client connects.

camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyExchangeO.name: camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyExchangeOnTimeout
camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyExchangeO.description: To send an empty message in case of timeout watching for a key.

camel.source.endpoint.timeout.name: camel.source.endpoint.timeout
camel.source.endpoint.timeout.description: To set the maximum time an action could take to complete.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.password.name: camel.source.endpoint.password
camel.source.endpoint.password.description: The password to use for basic authentication.

camel.source.endpoint.userName.name: camel.source.endpoint.userName
camel.source.endpoint.userName.description: The user name to use for basic authentication.

camel.component.etcd-watch.bridgeErrorHa.name: camel.component.etcd-watch.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.etcd-watch.bridgeErrorHa.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.etcd-watch.servicePath.name: camel.component.etcd-watch.servicePath
camel.component.etcd-watch.servicePath.description: The path to look for for service discovery

camel.component.etcd-watch.timeout.name: camel.component.etcd-watch.timeout
camel.component.etcd-watch.timeout.description: To set the maximum time an action could take to complete.

camel.component.etcd-watch.uris.name: camel.component.etcd-watch.uris
camel.component.etcd-watch.uris.description: To set the URIs the client connects.

camel.component.etcd-watch.sendEmptyExch.name: camel.component.etcd-watch.sendEmptyExchangeOnTimeout
camel.component.etcd-watch.sendEmptyExch.description: To send an empty message in case of timeout watching for a key.

camel.component.etcd-watch.autowiredEnab.name: camel.component.etcd-watch.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.etcd-watch.autowiredEnab.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.etcd-watch.password.name: camel.component.etcd-watch.password
camel.component.etcd-watch.password.description: The password to use for basic authentication.

camel.component.etcd-watch.useGlobalSslC.name: camel.component.etcd-watch.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.etcd-watch.useGlobalSslC.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.

camel.component.etcd-watch.userName.name: camel.component.etcd-watch.userName
camel.component.etcd-watch.userName.description: The user name to use for basic authentication.
